metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Instead of writing many if..else statements, you can use the switch statement.
content.html: Instead of writing many if..else statements, you can use the switch statement.

content.text: The switch statement selects one of many code blocks to be executed:
content.html: The switch statement selects one of many code blocks to be executed:

content.code_html:
switch(expression) {
  case x:
    // code block
    break;
  case y:
    // code block
    break;
  default:
    // code block
}

content.text: The example below uses the weekday number to calculate the weekday name:
content.html: The example below uses the weekday number to calculate the weekday name:

content.code_html:
int day = 4;
switch (day) {
  case 1:
    System.out.println("Monday");
    break;
  case 2:
    System.out.println("Tuesday");
    break;
  case 3:
    System.out.println("Wednesday");
    break;
  case 4:
    System.out.println("Thursday");
    break;
  case 5:
    System.out.println("Friday");
    break;
  case 6:
    System.out.println("Saturday");
    break;
  case 7:
    System.out.println("Sunday");
    break;
}
// Outputs "Thursday" (day 4)

content.text: When Java reaches a break keyword, it breaks out of the switch block.
content.html: When Java reaches a break keyword, it breaks out of the switch block.

content.text: This will stop the execution of more code and case testing inside the block.
content.html: This will stop the execution of more code and case testing inside the block.

content.text: When a match is found, and the job is done, it's time for a break. There is no need for more testing.
content.html: When a match is found, and the job is done, it's time for a break. There is no need for more testing.

content.text: A break can save a lot of execution time because it "ignores" the execution of all the rest of the code in the switch block.
content.html: A break can save a lot of execution time because it "ignores" the execution of all the rest of the code in the switch block.

content.text: The default keyword specifies some code to run if there is no case match:
content.html: The default keyword specifies some code to run if there is no case match:

content.code:
int
day
=

4
;


switch

(
day
)

{


case

6
:


System
.
out
.
println
(
"Today is Saturday"
)
;


break
;


case

7
:


System
.
out
.
println
(
"Today is Sunday"
)
;


break
;


default
:


System
.
out
.
println
(
"Looking forward to the Weekend"
)
;


}


// Outputs "Looking forward to the Weekend"
content.code_html:
int day = 4;
switch (day) {
  case 6:
    System.out.println("Today is Saturday");
    break;
  case 7:
    System.out.println("Today is Sunday");
    break;
  default:
    System.out.println("Looking forward to the Weekend");
}
// Outputs "Looking forward to the Weekend"

content.text: Note that if the default statement is used as the last statement in a switch block, it does not need a break.
content.html: Note that if the default statement is used as the last statement in a switch block, it does not need a break.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
True or False: The switch statement is used to select one of many code blocks to be executed, based on the value of an expression.
content.html:
True or False:

The switch statement is used to select one of many code blocks to be executed, based on the value of an expression.
